sentences.sentence: Police in Thailand have arrested a teenage suspected gunman after a deadly shooting at an upscale shopping center in Bangkok.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Former Soviet satellite Armenia has voted to join the International Criminal Court, which has indicted Russian President Vladimir Putin for war crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One person has died after a lone shooter opened fire in a luxury shopping mall in Thailand's capital city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The emergency services said six people were treated for injuries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Social media videos showed people running out of the building in Bangkok.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A 14-year-old suspect was arrested. showed people running out of the building in Bangkok a 14 year old suspect was arrested police have not said what appears to have motivated the attack Russian occupation officials continue to deport Ukrainian children to Russia and Russia-controlled occupied territories under the guise of educational trips.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Moscow-appointed Zaporizhia region occupation governor Evgeny Balitsky said that Russian Ministry of Culture transported over 300 Ukrainian schoolchildren from occupied Zaporizhia region to Moscow and St. Petersburg to quote educate them about Russian culture. Politsky stated that more than 2,500 Ukrainian schoolchildren from occupied Zaporizhia region in total will participate in these programs. Few days earlier Russian Yamal and Enets autonomous okra governor Dmitry Artukhov stated that the government is launching a three-year program that will bring children from occupied volnovaha here in donetsk region to russia to visit cultural heritage centers in moscow san petersburg and nizhny novgorod artukhov stated that 500 ukrainian children will participate in the program this autumn. According to Ukraine's National Information Bureau, over 19,500 children have been abducted or forcibly deported to Russia since its full-scale invasion of Ukraine began in February 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: However, officials fear that the real figure is actually much higher.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Deported Ukrainian children, including orphans, have little means to declare themselves missing or make contact with their relatives in Ukraine the Russian Federation argues that some seven hundred and forty four thousand children from Ukraine are now living in Russia or Russian held occupied territories they were often deported under the pretext of evacuation, treatment, vacation or rehabilitation trip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Armenia's parliament has voted to join the International Criminal Court, a move that's caused anger in Moscow and which has direct consequences for Russia's president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In March, the ICC indicted Vladimir Putin for abducting thousands of Ukrainian children. It means he can be arrested under warrant in any country that signed up to the Rome Statute, the international agreement under which the ICC was formed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As a result, Putin's been absent from international summits, including August gathering of the BRICS countries in South Africa. Putin's only input to the economic bloc's debates was conducted through video conference calls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Armenia, a former Soviet satellite country, said it had joined the ICC in the light of Azerbaijan's forceful seizure of Magorno-Karabakh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Azeris seized control under the noses of Russian peacekeeping forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The United Nations Children's Fund says more than 100,000 people from Nagorno-Karabakh, including some 30,000 children, have fled into Armenia, which is struggling to accommodate them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: UNICEF is providing humanitarian aid to ensure displaced children and families are cared for in centers like this one in the city of Goris, not far from the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A nine-month Azerbaijani blockade of the only road linking Nagorno-Karabakh with Armenia has left many children malnourished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Three scientists have won the Nobel Prize in Physics for the work documenting how electrons move around atoms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The experiments conducted by Pierre Agastoni, Franz Krauss and Anne Le Willier will help us better understand our universe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But there is also hope they will lead to more practical applications, such as better electronics and disease diagnoses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yes, this year's Nobel Prize in Physics is about science at the time scale of attoseconds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And what you see here is an attosecond related to one second, which is approximately the heartbeat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the ratio of one second to an attosecond is the same as the ratio of the age of the universe expressed in seconds to one second.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are now in the world of electrons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And Louillier is only the fifth woman to receive a Nobel Prize in physics, which comes with a cash prize of around 1 million euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Italian island of Lampedusa is marking a decade since a major shipwreck off its coast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: More than 360 people lost their lives in the early morning of October 3, 2013.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Several events have been organized on the island ahead of today's ceremony that have been attended by both every year since 2013 is to remember those who died in 2013 but also each and every person who has died trying to cross the Mediterranean in the past 10 years. 27000 people have died in the attempt of crossing the Mediterranean in the past 10 years. And the aim really is to try and answer one simple question.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: How is it possible that 10 years on shipwrecks still occur and that so many people die as a result of that?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And this has been really the main theme of this year's commemoration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Now, the event has been particularly significant as well, given that the share of migrant arrivals on the island has increased compared to previous years and that Lampedusa has indeed become the main point of arrival for migrants who try to reach Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Georgia Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: in Rome. Germany's border with Poland, new checks on those traveling between the two countries were introduced in the wake of the so-called visa scandal in the Polish government,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: where allegations of corruption have been made over the issuing of European visas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Today is the deadline for Poland to explain irregularities in its visa-issuing procedures in front of the European Commission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Allegations the country's Central Anti-Corruption Bureau has been investigating since July 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Polish government has provided limited information on the ongoing investigation, but journalists have discovered new irregularities related to intermediation in the visa application process VFS Global works with the Polish government that this is not a corrupt procedure and that all this kind of history was always announced by the police. tasks, checking the forms, etc. We don't get involved in visa decision-making processes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At no time since we've been working for the Polish government have any of our members of staff been arrested or investigated for any wrongdoing related to Poland visa services. There was an incident recently where some members of our staff have been accused of malpractice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That is for an operation related to another client government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And the moment we discovered these allegations, we immediately informed the local police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The visa scandal, but also the rising numbers of unregistered crossings on immigration routes, whether through Russia and Belarus or the Balkans, have made all Polish borders more closely monitored recently. And of course we conduct such checks also at the border with Germany, also in joint patrols with German services. Euronews from Svoboda. The United Nations has approved sending a security mission to Haiti.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The aid mission was requested last year by its government and the vote passed with 13 members in favor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia and China abstained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It aims to help Haitian authorities control an ongoing wave of violence between armed groups, which has already led to more than 3,000 murders this year alone and more than 1,500 kidnappings. The UN mission, which will be led by Kenya, is authorized to take all necessary measures to disarm the criminal groups.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Cherry blossoms in Paris. It's a sight that would have inspired awe and wonder if they just bloomed six months earlier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But this beautiful sight is now seen as an ominous warning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Further north, temperatures reach 27 degrees Celsius on Monday, which is impacting fruit trees and the farmers who planted them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We see an extravaganza of shoots, while it stopped growing in August.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And then we see a start of shoots of about 10 centimeters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The risk for the tree is that it will bloom very quickly and not at the right time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And then I could not have a harvest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: These events are a consequence of unusually high temperatures, and France is not alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Austria, Germany, Poland and Switzerland also recorded their hottest September on record.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: 2023 is also slotted to become the warmest in human history as climate change accelerates.
